availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Everett Jr. (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, soldier)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Isaac Everett and Adele Barney. Resident of Jefferson County in 1860. Second lieutenant in the 28th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from November 21, 1862, to January 8, 1863. Died January 8, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 968.
Registers of Deaths of Volunteers, compiled 1861–1865, Records of the Adjutant General's Office, 1780's–1917, Record Group 94, January 8, 1863 (accessed via ancestry.com).
E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry and Modern Activities, vol. 3 (Chicago and New York: Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), 1624.
